body_html:
nope, seem it does not work

This is what I did:
Test #1

  1. I modified the gru function by enabling only the GRU (as you suggested)
  2. Run training and save checkpoint as in the notebook
  3. Test few examples and it worked fine
  4. Restart the Encoder/Decoder
    encoder = Encoder(vocab_inp_size, embedding_dim, units, BATCH_SIZE)
    decoder = Decoder(vocab_tar_size, embedding_dim, units, BATCH_SIZE)
  5. Load checkpoint
  6. Test few examples and the result was pretty random.

Test #2

  1. I modified the gru function by enabling only the GRU
  2. Run training and save checkpoint as in the notebook
  3. Test few examples and it worked fine
  4. Change to CPU only mode
  5. Restart the Encoder/Decoder
  6. Load checkpoint
  7. Test few examples and the result was pretty random.

I did all tests using colab.

Regards,

body:
nope, seem it does not work

This is what I did:
Test #1
1.  I modified the gru function by enabling only the GRU (as you suggested)
2. Run training and save checkpoint as in the notebook
3. Test few examples and it worked fine
4. Restart the Encoder/Decoder 
     _encoder = Encoder(vocab_inp_size, embedding_dim, units, BATCH_SIZE)_
     _decoder = Decoder(vocab_tar_size, embedding_dim, units, BATCH_SIZE)_
5. Load checkpoint
6. Test few examples and the result was pretty random. 

Test #2
1.  I modified the gru function by enabling only the GRU
2. Run training and save checkpoint as in the notebook
3. Test few examples and it worked fine
4. Change to CPU only mode
5. Restart the Encoder/Decoder 
6. Load checkpoint
7. Test few examples and the result was pretty random. 

I did all tests using colab. 

Regards,
